Policy: Decree No. 49.948 regulating the State Policy of Family Agroindustry within the State of Rio Grande do Sul, and creating the related Steering Committee.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 16 articles, regulates the State Policy of Family Agroindustry within the State of Rio Grande do Sul and creates the related Steering Committee. The State Policy on Family Agroindustry (such as: enterprise owned by family farmers for the purpose of transforming raw materials from agricultural, livestock, fishery, aquaculture, and forestry activities) aims to: promote the increase of the supply of processed products in quantity and nutritional and sanitary quality, giving priority to the agroecological ones; reduce regional, social and environmental imbalances; strengthen actions to combat and eradicate hunger and poverty; to develop sustainable activities from the environmental, social, cultural and economic point of view; promote the establishment, regularization and development of family agroindustries in all regions of the State; expand, recover, strengthen and/or modernize family-owned agroindustrial units already in operation and under development; contribute to the organization of family farmers in cooperative, associative, especially in networks, and other enterprises of the popular and solidarity economy; increase the income of the target public by adding value to agricultural, livestock, fishery, forestry and other products obtained through planned or extractive production; create the conditions for access to the consumer market, encouraging efficient and environmentally sustainable logistics, preferentially stimulating the existence of short chains and direct marketing to the final consumer; provide for the creation and maintenance of work opportunities in rural areas, encouraging the farmer to continue his activity, with emphasis on young people and women, with a view to the succession of rural establishments; optimize the use of human and natural resources in rural establishments; provide training and access to the training of the target audience at all stages of the production chain, from production to consumption; support the establishment of service bases to support the management and provision of multidisciplinary technical services necessary for agroindustrial processing and quality control, financial and accounting management, advertising and communication, distribution and marketing; etc.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries

Policy: Disaster and Emergency Management Strategic Plan 2013-2017.
Policy_Content: The Disaster and Emergency Management Strategic Plan is a national plan covering the period 2013-2017, whose overall objective is to build a disaster resilient society. The Plan lays down goals, principles and objectives to be pursued by AFAD, which is an organization promoting rational utilization of resources in this multi-dimensional and multi-actor area and carrying out its activities on a multi-disciplinary basis. The integrated disaster management system adopted as the pillar of risk management by AFAD consists of four axes: 1) mitigation; 2) preparedness; 3) response; 4) recovery. With its vision, AFAD foresees to be an organization which is risk management oriented, having the importance of sustainable development, taking care of effectiveness, efficiency and reliability on service delivery, strong at the international level and coordinating effectively all organizations which are taking charge in disaster management. According to AFAD’s disaster and emergency management policies, priority shall be given to the reduction of risks and damages, getting support from internal and external stakeholders for disaster and emergency management, as well as endeavours to ensure uninterrupted cooperation with all sorts of agencies and organizations that work in the field of disaster and emergency management and that engage in research and develop.

Policy: Order No. 1178 on mandatory storage of oil.
Policy_Content: The Order sets regulations with regard to the mandatory storage/stockage of crude oil, oil products, biofuel, additives etc. in use by international marine transportation. The Association of Danish Oil Contingency Stocks (FDO) is designated as the central storage unit for oil storage from 31 May 2012, in accordance to article 5 (section 1) of the Oil Preparedness Act. Companies trading in oil shall utilize the FDO for all storage of crude oil. International stockage agreements may occur between Danish and foreign commercial businesses for the storage of such commodity, provided both parties shall comply with Danish stockage regulations. A part of reserves held by the central storage unit must store specific stocks, and the latter should consist of products (Category 1, 2B and 3) which shall be utilized for domestic consumption within 30 days. Information of storage activities shall be registered and kept confidential.

Policy: Malawi National Export Strategy (NES) 2013-2018.
Policy_Content: The National Export Strategy (NES) is a national sectoral strategy applicable to the export sector during the 2013-2018 period. Its objectives are to: Develop three priority clusters in which Malawi can compete and that have strong economic spillovers, thus allowing for the diversification of exports. These clusters are oil seed products, sugar cane products and manufacturing. The aim is for these clusters to account for 13%, 15% and 18% of imports by 2027. Support existing export clusters (tobacco, mining, tea, tourism, services) such that their contribution to exports and to matching Malawi’s import bill can be maximised. Improve the enabling environment for the productive base such that investment growth may increase from 14% between 2001 and 2011 to 23% per year between 2012 and 2022. This investment will span both: Productive sectors, including domestic and foreign direct investment into the production of competitive goods and services for export. Enabling sectors, or those necessary to address supply-side constraints, such as energy, finance and transport. Develop supportive economic institutions necessary to allow the enabling environment to improve, and hence drive investment. Improve skills, competencies and knowledge to empower Malawians and support the productive base of the economy.

Policy: Bonnes pratiques agro-sylvo-pastorales d’amélioration durable de la fertilité des sols au Burkina Faso
Policy_Content: Le présent document approuve les bonnes pratiques agro-sylvo-pastorales d’amélioration durable de la fertilité des sols au Burkina Faso. Le document prévoit que les bonnes pratiques d’amélioration durable de la fertilité des sols sont multiples. En effet par exemple, l’agronomie porte sur les domaines de gestion des cultures, d’aménagement du lit des cultures et de l’alimentation des cultures. Ainsi, pour permettre une bonne vision de ces technologies, elles ont été regroupées selon la logique suivante : les pratiques agronomiques qui concernent toutes les pratiques visant à une production accrue, diversifiée et préservatrice de l’environnement et du sol ; les aménagements ou pratiques physiques des terres à des fins agricoles, portant sur tout ce qui est aménagements des sols que ce soit manuel, traction animale ou motorisée qui permettent de mieux gérer les cultures pour une production accrue et durable ; les pratiques biologiques. Il s’agira dans cette partie de mettre l’accent sur toute pratique biologique visant à relever le niveau de fertilité des sols tout en préservant l’environnement ; les pratiques zootechniques ; les pratiques combinées ; et autres pratiques.

Policy: Regulation No. 1108 on the education, rights and obligations of administrative dieticians and criteria for granting of licences.
Policy_Content: This Regulation concerns the education, rights and obligations of administrative dieticians and the criteria for granting licences. It applies to administrative dieticians licensed by the Medical Director of Health - the entity responsible for granting licences authorising the use of the professional title of administrative dietician and to practise as such in Iceland. The Regulation consists of four sections:  I. General provisions; II. Licenses; III. Rights and obligations; IV. Various provisions. According to article 5, an administrative dieticians shall perform his/her tasks vigilantly and conscientiously and in accordance with the professional standards required of the profession at any time;  must be aware of his/her duties and respect ethical rules of the profession, maintain his/her knowledge and professional skill, and master innovations in his/her field of work; shall be familiar with legislation and regulations applying to healthcare practitioners and healthcare services, and other legislation and government directives, as applicable; is responsible for the administration of health institution kitchens and counselling he/she provides; shall recognise his/her professional limitations, and seek the assistance of another healthcare practitioner as necessary.

Policy: Cyprus National Strategy on Antimicrobial Resistance to Antibiotics.
Policy_Content: The Cyprus National Strategy for the Treatment of Antibiotic Resistance to Antibiotics. In line with international efforts, the National Strategy aims to safeguard the availability of effective antimicrobial treatment for humans and animals. Primary goal: Development and implementation of actions that will result in the reduction of the observed antibiotic resistance to antibiotics in Cyprus. Side goals: Improving closely related parameters such as: The Frequency of Infections Related to the Provision of Health Services. The use of antibiotics in veterinary and animal husbandry. The Axes on which it is based are: I. Surveillance and recording; II. Improving the diagnosis and use of antibiotics in humans and animals; III. Strengthen infection control and prevention measures; IV. Education and awareness raising; V. Research.

Policy: Regulation N. 1157 on regulating protective security and emergency preparedness in energy supply (Emergency Regulation).
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets rules on objectives of the Energy Act's articles 1-2 with regard to ensuring that energy supply is maintained and that normal supply is restored in an efficient and safe manner in extraordinary situations in order to reduce social consequences. Among these regulations, it gives guidelines for the prevention, management and mitigation of the effects of extraordinary situations that may damage or prevent the generation, transmission and distribution of electricity and district heating. It applies to establishments regulated by the Power Supply Emergency Organisation (KBO). These regulations also apply to the establishments for decisions taken by the KBO and all the latter’s units must conduct risk and vulnerability analysis to extraordinary circumstances. The analysis (reviewed annually) shall be on such scale that units can identify risk and vulnerability to all features, facilities and initiatives of importance and meeting the Regulation's requirements. KBO may be given tasks during emergency and war according to article 9-1 (section 5) of the Energy Act and after the emergency authority deems it necessary. Extraordinary circumstances are classified as: Storms and other natural damages; fire and explosions; serious technical failures; burglary, vandalism, sabotage and other crimes. The classification of plants having significant impact on operations, or recovery or security in power supply, transmission or district heating use Class 1 (power station with a total installation generating capacity of minimum 25 MVA), Class 2 (power station with a total installation generating capacity of minimum 100 MVA power plants and at least 100 MVA on a daily basis), Class 3 (Power station in the mountains with a total installed generator capacity of 250 MVA) where the importance of energy supply is greatest.

The Regulation, among other things, provides with respect to: conservation and protection of rural land and land use planning for this purpose;  protection of remnant forests; conditions necessary to acquire rural land by private persons; distribution of irrigation land; use of rural land (also for investment purposes); lease of rural land; exchange of land; utilization of rural land for social services; rural land registration and certification; dispute and conflict resolution;  duties and responsibilities of the Rural Land and Environmental Protection Bureau, the Zonal Administration Office, the Woreda Administration Office and the Kebele Administration (Kebele Rural Land Administration and use Committees are established under these Regulations); offences.

Policy: Decree No. 192 of the Ministry of Public Health validating Sanitary rules and regulations “Requirements for organization and application of sanitary and antiepidemic arrangements for prophylaxis of diseases transmitted by ixodic tick”.
Policy_Content: This Decree validates mandatory Sanitary rules and regulations “Requirements for organization and application of sanitary and antiepidemic arrangements for prophylaxis of diseases transmitted by ixodic tick”. Antiepidemic arrangements must include: (a) prevention of ixodic tick attacks on human beings; (b) impact on infection reservoirs (small mammals); and (c) prophylaxis of spreading of disease after bite by disease transmitting agent. The main disease carriers on the national territory are the following insect species: (a) Ixodes ricinus L.; and (b) Dermacentor reticulatus Herm. Disinsection and deratization treatment by authorized formulations for treatment with a view of extermination of ixodic tick and rodents shall be regularly performed by the competent sanitary bodies in accordance with contracts.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force 15 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Intellectual Property Organization of Pakistan Act, 2012 (No. XXII).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 39 sections, creates the Intellectual Property Organization of Pakistan. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the Organization. The Federal Government shall constitute a Policy Board of the Organization entitled to: a) take policy decisions as well as advise the Federal Government on all matters relating to: developing processes and proposing rules for the services designed to ensure protection of intellectual property laws in Pakistan; ensuring implementation of intellectual property rights in coordination with concerned agencies; b) consider and approve policies, plans and programmes of the Organization; c) consider and approve, with or without modification, any regulations, with respect to implementation of policy decisions proposed to be made by the Organization under this Act; d) formulate procedures and necessary framework for utilization of funds generated or acquired through services, donations, investments or grants, etc.; e) specify and propose fees, penalties and other charges chargeable by the Organization with the approval of Federal Government for carrying out the purposes of this Act; and f) exercise all such powers and perform all such functions as are conferred or assigned to it under this Act.

Policy: Law on the Energy Performance of Buildings (2012)
Policy_Content: The Law determines principles for energy efficiency of buildings in Latvia. Its purpose is to promote rational use of energy resources, improving the energy performance of buildings, as well as to informing society regarding the energy consumption of buildings. It prescribes the minimum energy performance requirements of existing buildings; the minimum energy performance requirements of buildings to be designed, reconstructed or renovated; and the requirements for the certification of the energy performance of buildings and the inspection of heating systems and air conditioning systems. The requirements of this Law are not however applicable to buildings for which energy is not used for regulating indoor climatic conditions; which are cultural monuments or in which cultural monuments are located, as well as buildings in the territories of cultural monuments, if the fulfilment of the requirements of the Law endangers the preservation of those cultural monuments or reduces their cultural and historical value; which have been designed and built for religious services and other religious activities; which have been designed and built for use only during the warm seasons (for example, summer houses); and the total heating area of which is less than 50 square metres.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Greenhouse Gas Emissions Trading Scheme Regulations 2012 (S.I. No. 3038 of 2012).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement Directive 2003/87/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council and, in particular, the amendments to the Directive made by Directive 2009/29/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council. They concern an EU emissions trading scheme for greenhouse gases. An overall cap is set for emissions of greenhouse gases from specified activities. Operators must monitor and report emissions, and surrender sufficient emissions trading allowances to cover their emissions for each year. The Regulations, among other things: require the Secretary of State to review the operation and effect of these Regulations and publish a report within five years after they come into force and within every five years after that; lay down requirements for the submission of applications, notices or reports under the Regulations; provide for matters of administration; provide for the review, variation and consolidation of permits; and make provision for the free allocation of allowances to those installations that are entitled to such an allocation.

Policy: Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry Administration Decree (No. 695 of 2012).
Policy_Content: This Regulation provides with respect to the governance and organization of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry. It contains detailed rules regarding management, functions, powers, financial arrangements, staff, etc. The Ministry shall have various departments including the Food Department and the Natural Resources Department. The Food  Department shall consist of: a food safety unit, a unit for animal and plant health, a unit for rural development, a unit for rural network and an agricultural unit. The Natural Resources Department shall include a unit for fisheries, a unit for recreation, a unit for natural resource and water management, and a forestry and bioenergy unit. For coordination of matters related to the European Union, there is a unit for EU coordination which shall be administratively governed by the Food Department. The Regulation sets out the filed of activities of each Department and the functions of each unit. The Natural Resources Department will also be responsible for the Forest Agency, the Finland Forestry Centre, Forestry Development Centre Tapio and the Finnish Wildlife Agency. Also various other institutions in the field of agriculture, forestry, fisheries, wildlife management and ecosystem preservation are supervised by the Ministry.

Policy_Content: Regional target program "Development Agricultural sector of Nizhny Novgorod of the region for 2013-2020" is cross-sectoral regional policy document, which establishes the goal of the Program as follows: (a) provision of the regional population with high-quality foodstuffs in accordance with the rates set by the Food Security Doctrine of the Russian Federation; (b) creation of conditions for increasing the competitiveness of agricultural commodities based on the innovative development of the agro-industrial complex; (c) creation of conditions for sustainable rural development; and (d) creation of conditions for preserving and increasing the efficiency of the use of land and other resources in agriculture. The main objectives of the Program shall be as follows: (a) stimulating growth in agricultural production; (b) creation of conditions for increasing the efficiency of production of the main types of foodstuffs; (c) development of small forms of managing and cooperation; (d) strengthening the financial and economic condition of agricultural producers; (e) stimulation of innovative activity and innovative development of agribusiness; (f) supporting the development of production infrastructure, technical and technological potential of the agro-industrial complex; (g) scientific and methodological support for the effective development of the agro-industrial complex; (h) improving the quality of life of the rural population; (i)  capacity building of staff employed in the agricultural sector; (j) improvement of agricultural land and soil; and (k) promotion of drainage of agricultural land.

Policy: Tuul River Basin Integrated Water Management Plan.
Policy_Content: This Integrated Water Management Plan for the Tuul River Basin is one of the two basin model plans developed pursuant to the Law on Water.  The Plan is approved and implemented for the purpose of conducting inter-sectoral management and defining the sectors’ future development on the basis of the river basin water resources. The Tuul river basin management plan has 9 chapters and 122 sub topics. Chapter describes the geography and natural conditions; the second Chapter describes the water resources and water quality; Chapter 3 describes the socio-economic development; Chapter 4 describes the water use and water demand of the socioeconomic sectors and about hydro constructions; the 5th Chapter describes the water use balance; Chapter 6 describes the negative impacts on the water resources and about water fees and water tariffs; Chapter 7 describes the challenges of the water management plan and the strategic objectives; Chapter 8 describes the integrated water resources management plan measures; and the last Chapter describes the implementing organization, structure and monitoring of the plan. The table of measures consists of 19 challenges and 232 activities. Chapters 3,4 and 5 contain measures and recommendations relative to the water management, water uses and demand for various purposes including agriculture

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 697 validating the Regulation on the performance of state environmental audit.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that the performance of state environmental audit shall be subject to submittal of the application by the customer or the originator of the project documentation attached with materials on environmental impact assessment by authorized experts bodies of the Committee on Environmental Protection under the Government of the Republic Tajikistan. The objects of the state environmental audit shall be project and other documentation on the planned economic and other activities. Project documentation includes: (a) urban projects of general, special and detailed land-use planning, architectural development projects of territories; (b) substantiation of investment in construction, project documentation (architectural, construction projects and others) on construction, reconstruction, expansion, technical renovation, improvement, changing the direction of production, liquidation (decommissioning) of facilities and complexes, regardless of the types of ownership and management; (c) projects of territorial integrated use schemes of natural resources management and environmental protection; and (d) projects of water protection zones and coastal strips of water objects. Other documentation includes: (a) draft concepts, forecasts, programs and sectoral development schemes, the implementation of which is associated with the use of natural resources and/or affecting the environment; (b) hunting management projects; (c) forest management projects; (d) draft technical regulatory legal acts, in which environmental requirements and/or rational use of natural resources related to products, processes of its development, production, operation, storage, transportation,  trade and recycling thereof or provision of services. Other projects may be objects of environmental impact assessment by types of economic and other activities the implementation of which causes environmental impact.

Policy: Law No. 9.926 providing for the State Unified Care System for Agricultural and Animal Health (SUASA).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 15 Chapters, provides for the State Unified Care System for Agricultural and Animal Health (SUASA). It establishes responsibilities and duties such as: controlling violations and implementing agricultural defense and establishing the procedure for calculation of fines. Health promotion, actions of surveillance and animals, plants and products and agricultural by-products health protection, is organized under the coordination of the State Government in SUASA, articulated, as is National Health System, and for the interest of consumers. Policy: Decree No. 1105 of the Council of Ministers validating the list of measures of technical (technological, verifying) type.
Policy_Content: This Decree assigns to the Ministries the function of inspection (verification) of technical (technological) conditions of premises and facilities for storage of different articles, commodities and substances. The Ministry of Interior shall be responsible for inspection of storage facilities for firearms, including those for civilian use. The Ministry of Housing and Communal Services shall be responsible for survey and inspection of sources of potable water supply, including verification of radiation safety of potable water. The Ministry of Forest Management shall be responsible for verification of forest fire control measures and fulfilment of forest management planning. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection shall be responsible for investigation of cases of environmental pollution, including emissions to the atmospheric air, and loss of wild flora and wild fauna species. The Ministry of Agriculture and Food shall be responsible for inspection, verification and survey of agricultural machinery and equipment, waterworks, verification of quality and safety of feedstuffs, feed additives, drugs, examination of livestock for identification and liquidation of animal diseases, and verification of quality of seeds and planting material.

Policy: Local Government Byelaws (Wales) Act 2012 (2012 anaw 2).

Each of the following is a legislating authority for the purposes of this Act: (a) a council for a county or county borough in Wales; (b) a community council; (c) a National Park authority in Wales; (d) the Countryside Council for Wales. A council for a county or county borough in Wales may make byelaws : (a) for the good rule and government of the whole or any part of its area; (b) for the prevention and suppression of nuisances in its area. Policy: Act (2012:806) on contingency storage of oil.
Policy_Content: The Act sets regulations concerning Sweden's contingency storage of oil reserves, supervision and fees thereof. National storage in a year shall be of at least either 90 days of average daily net import or 61 days of average daily domestic consumption during the referred year. Imported crude oil storage shall be equivalent to at least 50 000 cubic meters. Permit is required for the storage outside Sweden. Regulatory authorities shall keep track of registered stock and report the information to the European Commission. Swedish government shall determine the stock usage according to the International Energy Agency (IEA) decision on making crude oil or petroleum products available; and to the European Commission's decision on possible supply disruption needing emergency response - in which case immediate notification is due.

Policy: Order No. 1150 on the management of mining waste.
Policy_Content: This Order sets rules on the management of extractive waste. Waste facilities handling extractive waste dumping into water bodies (inland and marine) shall be subject to pre-approval from national authorities and specific criteria must be met with regard to the classification and the planning management of waste. The purpose of these regulations aims to ensure that accidents are prevented and that the handling of waste is contained in order to exclude or limit damages to the environment.  Chemicals and other minerals shall be classified according to the authorized quantity of hazardous substances contained in extractive waste and are listed in the enclosed Appendices. Waste processing facilities shall comply with authorized maximum concentrations of cyanide containing weak acidity when dumping tailings into water bodies as follows: 50 ppm from 7 January 2013, 25 ppm from 1 May 2013, and 10 ppm from 1 May 2018. Safety management procedures shall be applied to prevent accidents when handling waste and strategic planning of these procedures (including plans for closure of such waste facilities) shall be notified to the Environmental Protection Agency.

Policy: Ley de Turismo Sustentable del Estado de Hidalgo.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece las bases para el ordenamiento y gestión del sector turístico del Estado de Hidalgo, así como los mecanismos de planeación, promoción, fomento, regulación y desarrollo local sustentable de la actividad turística. La Ley contempla disposiciones específicas para el turismo rural y comunitario (relacionado con las comunidades indígenas) y el turismo ecológico. La Ley define como turismo sustentable a aquel que cumple con las siguientes tres directrices: a) dar un uso adecuado a los recursos naturales aptos para el desarrollo turístico, ayudando a conservarlos con apego a las leyes en la materia; b) respetar la autenticidad sociocultural de las comunidades anfitrionas, conservando sus atractivos culturales, sus valores tradicionales y arquitectónicos; y c) asegurar el desarrollo de las actividades económicas viables, que reporten beneficios socioeconómicos y que contribuyan a mejorar las condiciones de vida.

Policy: Act on floods and storm damages (No. 1129 of 2014).
Policy_Content: The Act sets rules on the compensation for damages caused by storms, floods from lakes and/or watercourses, including the financial subsidy for the reforestation on private forest reserve areas damaged by storms. Subsidy may be granted to private owners, however it shall not be granted to indirect loss of livestock (except animals bred in fish farms), property and harbors and the likes. A special council shall be established – the Storm Council – to administer and grant subsidies. The Council shall provide funding to parts of areas hit by storm and equivalent to 1/60 of the vegetated forest – including temporary non-vegetated areas and at least 0.5 hectares for each forest (article 13). The Coastal Authority and the Danish Meteorological Institute are responsible for flood warning and requests, providing assistance to the Storm Council. Chapter 7a sets regulations with regard to all communication related to thiese provisions and which must occur digitally.

Policy: Décret n° 2018-067/PR du 21 /03/2018 portant publication de l’Accord portant création de l’institution de la mutuelle panafricaine de gestion des risques (ARC), signé à Pretoria, le 23 novembre 2012 .
Policy_Content: Le présent décret publie l'Accord qui crée la mutuelle panafricaine de gestion des risques (ARC, signé à Pretoria, le 23 novembre 2012) en tant qu’institution spécialisée de l’Union Africaine (UA) dans le but d’aider ses Etats membres à améliorer leurs capacités en vue de mieux planifier, de mieux se préparer et de mieux répondre à des événements météorologiques extrêmes et à des catastrophes naturelles. A cet effet, l’objectif de l’Institution de l’ARC consiste à aider les Etats membres à réduire le risque de pertes et de dommages causés par des événements météorologiques extrêmes et des catastrophes naturelles qui affectent les populations africaines en fournissant des réponses ciblées aux désastres plus rapidement et de manière financièrement avantageuse, objective et transparente.

Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Ley del Sistema de Certificación en Materia Ambiental.
Policy_Content: Por la presente Ley se establece el Sistema de Certificación en Materia Ambiental para las personas físicas o jurídicas que soliciten la emisión de certificados de origen de mercaderías por parte de la Secretaría de Desarrollo Sustentable y Ambiente, la Secretaría de Energía e Hidrocarburos y el Ministerio de Industria e Innovación Productiva de la Provincia. Dichos certificados tienen por finalidad acreditar que el solicitante se encuentra en cumplimiento de las normas ambientales provinciales realizando una adecuada gestión de residuos, desperdicios, desechos y pasivos ambientales. Por otro lado se establece que las empresas de gestión de desechos de origen industrial deberán confeccionar un Certificado de Tratamiento de Residuos donde quedará documentada la trazabilidad de residuos, desperdicios y desechos recibidos de parte de las empresas generadoras.

En este sentido establece que los titulares de concesiones de exploración y explotación de todo tipo de hidrocarburos localizados en el territorio provincial deberán contratar servicios y adquirir bienes prioritariamente, de personas físicas o jurídicas efectivamente radicadas en la Provincia de Tierra del Fuego.

Policy: European Communities (Conservation of Wild Birds (Carlingford Lough Special Protection Area 004078)) Regulations 2012 (S.I. No. 464 of 2012).
Policy_Content: These Regulations designate an area consisting of land and waters as a Special Protection Area in accordance with Article 4 of Directive 2009/147/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the Conservation of Wild Birds. The purpose is to ensure protection from disturbance, capture and damage to nests and eggs under Article 5 of the Directive for all species of birds, not just the birds listed on Schedule 3 (with the exception of those birds covered under Articles 7 for hunting and 9, where derogations are listed). Schedule 4 lists activities that require the consent of the Minister and may cause disturbance or damage to birds protected under Schedule 3. Activities that require consent of the Minister include: land reclamation; introduction, or re-introduction, of plants or animals not found in the area; cutting, uprooting or otherwise removing plants; water abstraction, sinking of boreholes and wells; drainage works; and planting of trees or multi-annual bioenergy crops. Operations or activities other than those listed at Schedule 4, such as effluent discharge, construction work, aquaculture, fishing or forestry require a licence or permission from the appropriate consent authority.

Policy: Administrative Order No. 34 creating an Inter-Agency Committee on institutional arrangements for Land Management and Rural Development.
Policy_Content: This Administrative Order, consisting of 8 sections, creates an Inter-Agency Committee on institutional arrangements for Land Management and Rural Development. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Committee, entitled to: conduct research on land distribution and management and supporting agricultural and fisheries sectors, in consideration of the following: approval of land surveys and issuance of land titles with the objective of creating a system that shall ensure stable property rights; consolidate and rationalize land management and distribution functions of the government; comply with the mandate of Comprehensive Agrarian Reform Programme (CARP), including: distribution of the remaining land acquisition and balance under the programme; collective titles; rationalize the provision of support services to farmers and fisherfolk; interaction among the institutions involved in agricultural extension services; formulate appropriate executive issuances or legislative measures for the required institutional arrangements, based on the findings of the study that will be undertaken; information sharing for achieving consensus among all stakeholders and arriving at an unified plan to implement the necessary institutional arrangements.
Subject: Fisheries, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, North Pacific, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Order shall take effect after its publication.

Policy: Act No.CLXVI of 2012 on the identification, designation and protection of essential systems and facilities.
Policy_Content: Designation or withdrawal of designation of facilities as part of the national essential system may be initiated by the operator of a given facility or by an organ with proposal making power. The same is valid for facilities of European relevance with the difference that a member state of the European Economic Area may also initiate the designation process. A register of designated facilities must be kept. According to Art. 6 a safety operational plan must be prepared by the operator of the designated facility. Article 8 provides rules of control on the operation of designated facilities. Articles 10-13 contain special provisions regarding facilities of the energy sector, including electric energy, oil and liquid hydro-carbons, and natural gas.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The consolidated version of the Act entered into force on 1 January 2014.

Policy: Directive 2012/33/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Council Directive 1999/32/EC as regards the sulphur content of marine fuels.
Policy_Content: This Directive lays down some amendments to Directive 1999/32/EC relating to a reduction in the sulphur content of certain liquid fuels. The amendments concern in particular the sulphur content of marine fuels. The definitions of heavy fuel oil and gas oil are amended. As regards marine fuels, the Directive stipulates that Member States must ensure that marine fuels are not used within their territory if their sulphur content exceeds 3,50 percent by mass, except for fuels supplied to ships using emission abatement methods.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Sea, Environment gen.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 783 validating the Regulation on Coordination commission on climate change.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the legal status of Coordination commission on climate change and regulates the issues pertaining to its competence. The scope of Coordination commission shall be guidance and coordination of the activity of ministries, departments and organizations for implementation of the obligations of the Kyrgyz Republic originating from the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change and Kyoto Protocol. The main functions of the Commission shall be: (a) elaboration, processing, periodical updating and publication of data requested by UNFCCC; (b) coordination of activity of the ministries and departments; (c) assistance in elaboration, application and spreading technologies for reduction greenhouse gases; (d) coordination of rational use of greenhouse gas sinks and reservoirs; and (e) assistance in scientific research related to climate change.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Amendment of the Law of the Sea
Policy_Content: This Act, which consists of 46 articles, introduces some amendments to the Law of the Sea of 20 September 1964. In particular, the amendments include minor ones, such as changing the name of the Country from “Iran” to “Islamic Republic of Iran” to the upgrade in prices and costs due to inflation. Policy: Decree on the permissible level of pollution and and implementation of certain other provisions of the Air Protection Act.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Ministry of the Environment, which is composed of 30 articles and 16 Annexes, implements the relevant European Union regulations and provides: (1) details on determining the level of pollution; (2) general emission limits, specific emission limits, the method of calculating the emission limits and technical conditions of stationary sources; (3) requirements for fuel quality; (4) requirements for products containing volatile organic compounds; (5) details on summaries, expert opinion and study protocol on measurement of emissions. The present Decree is composed of the following Sections: Introductory provisions (Sec. 1); Evaluation of pollution level and compliance with pollution limits (Sec. 2); Fuel combustion (Sec. 3); Fuel quality requirements (Sec. 4); Thermal waste treatment (Sec. 5); Volatile organic compounds (Sec. 6); Other stationary sources (Sec. 7); General emission limits (Sec. 8); Compensation measures (Sec. 9); Transitional and final provisions (Sec. 10); Entry into force (Sec. 11).

Policy: Regulation (EU) No. 1151/2012 of the European Parliament and of the Council on quality schemes for agricultural products and foodstuffs.
Policy_Content: This Regulation aims to help producers of agricultural products and foodstuffs to communicate the product characteristics and farming attributes of those products and foodstuffs to buyers and consumers, ensuring: (a) fair competition for farmers and producers of agricultural products and foodstuffs having value-adding characteristics and attributes; (b) the availability to consumers of reliable information pertaining to such products; (c) respect for intellectual property rights. In particular the Regulation sets out quality schemes which provide the basis for the identification and protection of names and terms that indicate or describe agricultural products with value-adding characteristics. The Annex lays down the list of agricultural products and foodstuffs covered by these provisions.

Son funciones del Defensor del Pueblo: 1) Verificar y mediar cualquier conducta irregular en las relaciones entre la administración publica o privada y los ciudadanos; 2) Informar y denunciar ante los órganos competentes sobre conductas no conformes con las leyes; 3) Mediar en los conflictos que puedan surgir entre la Administración y los administrados, proponiendo las soluciones correspondientes a los Órganos competentes, según los casos; 4) Conocer de los recursos de amparo y protección contra las disposiciones y actos que violen los derechos y libertades reconocidos en la Ley Fundamental; 5) Poder iniciar y proseguir de oficio o a petición de parte, cualquier investigación conducente al esclarecimiento de los actos y resoluciones de la Administración Publica y sus agentes, en relación con los ciudadanos, y el respeto debido a los derechos proclamados en la Ley Fundamental.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement flamand portant octroi d'aides aux entreprises pour des investissements écologiques stratégiques en Région flamande.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté du Gouvernement flamand porte octroi d'aides aux entreprises pour des investissements écologiques stratégiques en Région flamande. Notamment, il met en exécution le décret du 16 mars 2012 relatif à la politique d'aide économique e le décret portant les dispositions générales en matière de la politique de l’énergie du 8 mai 2009. L’article 5 établit que la valeur stratégique des investissements écologiques pour l'entreprise est confrontée aux critères suivants: 1) le projet offre une solution environnementale ou énergétique générale au niveau de l'entreprise à l'aide de cycles fermés d'énergie et de matériaux ainsi que de solutions intégrées dans les processus. Les investissements écologiques qui sont repris ou qui potentiellement éligibles à être repris dans la liste limitative des technologies qui est jointe en annexe à l'arrêté ministériel portant exécution de l'arrêté du Gouvernement flamand du 17 décembre 2010 portant octroi d'aides aux entreprises pour des investissements écologiques réalisés en Région flamande, doivent constituer une minorité de la totalité du projet; 2) le projet cadre dans une vison générale de l'entreprise vis-à-vis de l'environnement ou de l'utilisation durable d'énergie dans l'entreprise; 3) le projet envisage toujours des objectifs environnementaux ou énergétiques génériques. Le Ministre détermine les modalités relatives aux critères.

Policy: Law No. 9.923 establishing the State Policy on the Technical Assistance and Rural Extension for Family Farming and Agrarian Reform of the State of Espírito Santo (PEATER/ES) and the State Programme of Technical Assistance and Rural Extension for Family Agriculture and Agrarian Reform of the State of Espírito Santo - PROATERES.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 6 Chapters, establishes the State Policy on the Technical Assistance and Rural Extension for Family Farming and Agrarian Reform of the State of Espírito Santo (PEATER/ES) and the State Programme of Technical Assistance and Rural Extension for Family Agriculture and Agrarian Reform of the State of Espírito Santo (PROATERES). Their management, social control and formulation will be of competence of the State Council for Sustainable Rural Development (CEDRS). They aim at promoting sustainable rural development and improving the quality of life of the beneficiaries; supporting economic initiatives that promote regional and local potentiality, especially promoting endogenous development processes; increasing production, quality and productivity of agricultural services and non-agricultural activities, including agro-extractive, forestry, fisheries, etc., respecting the principles of agroecology and sustainable development; advising the various stages of economic activities, business management, organization, production, market insertion and supply, including family farmers on the market; developing initiatives to use, manage, protect, conserve and rehabilitate natural resources, agricultural ecosystems and biodiversity; building sustainable production systems, considering the scientific and traditional knowledge, from agro-ecological foundations; contributing to increase the income of beneficiaries and add value to their production; stimulating, strengthening and structuring associations and cooperatives; promoting the development and appropriation of technical and organizational innovation; and integrating the local, regional and national production markets. The beneficiaries of PEATER/ES are: agrarian reform beneficiaries of the National Land Credit Program, indigenous peoples, quilombolas, pomeranians, gypsies, other people and traditional communities, urban and peri-urban farmers.

Policy: European Communities (Conservation of Wild Birds (Lough Ree Special Protection Area 004064)) Regulations 2012 (S.I. No. 456 of 2012).
Policy_Content: These Regulations designate an area consisting of land and waters as a Special Protection Area in accordance with Article 4 of Directive 2009/147/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the Conservation of Wild Birds. The purpose is to ensure protection from disturbance, capture and damage to nests and eggs under Article 5 of the Directive for all species of birds, not just the birds listed on Schedule 3 (with the exception of those birds covered under Articles 7 for hunting and 9, where derogations are listed). Schedule 4 lists activities that require the consent of the Minister and may cause disturbance or damage to birds protected under Schedule 3. Activities that require consent of the Minister include: land reclamation; introduction, or re-introduction, of plants or animals not found in the area; cutting, uprooting or otherwise removing plants; water abstraction, sinking of boreholes and wells; drainage works; and planting of trees or multi-annual bioenergy crops. Operations or activities other than those listed at Schedule 4, such as effluent discharge, construction work, aquaculture, fishing or forestry require a licence or permission from the appropriate consent authority.

Policy: Order No. 390 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on the national park “Paanajarvi”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that the location of the national park “Paanajarvi” shall be Karelia region of the Russian Federation. National park “Paanajarvi” shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and objects; (b) conservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) promotion of regulated tourism and recreation; (e) development and introduction of scientific methods of nature protection and environmental education; (f) implementation of state environmental monitoring; and (g) restoration of disturbed natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects. On the territory of the national park, shall be prohibited any activity that can damage natural complexes and objects of flora and fauna, cultural and historical objects and which contradicts the purposes and tasks of the national park, including: (a) exploration and mining; (b) disturbance of the soil cover and geological outcrops; (c) activities entailing changes in the hydrological regime; (d) allotment of land parcels for horticulture and smallholding; (e) construction of main roads, pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities, except for tourism industry facilities, museums and information centers, facilities related to the functioning of the national park and the functioning of settlement located within its boundaries; (f) logging (except for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) commercial, sports and artisanal hunting, commercial fisheries; (i) procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (with the exception of procurement by citizens of such resources for their own personal needs); (j) disturbance of natural habitats of wild fauna and wild flora species; (k) biological collections, except for research purposes, envisaged by thematic and research plans of the Institution; (l) introduction of living organisms in order to acclimatize them; (m) passage and grazing of domestic animals; (n) water logging; (o) organization of mass sports and entertainment events, organization of tourist camps and making bonfires outside the specially designated places for such purpose; (p) unauthorized conduct of archaeological excavations, collection and removal of objects of historical and cultural value; (q) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, including hunting firearms and hunting gear; (r) blasting operations; (s) burning of vegetation (with the exception of fire-fighting measures implemented in coordination with the Institution); (t) clear cutting of forest species and shrubbery, with the exception of sanitary felling, felling associated with extinguishing forest fires, including the creation of fire breaks, and felling associated with the construction, reconstruction and operation of line facilities carried out in accordance with this Regulations; (u) waste disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste, radioactive waste, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances; (v) washing vehicles on the banks of waterbodies; (w) movement and parking of motorized vehicles outside public roads and specially designated places (except for cases related to the functioning of the national park); (x) destruction and damage of posts, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs, developed ecological paths and recreation areas, buildings on the territory of the national park, as well as property of the Institution, inscriptions and signs on boulders, outcrops and historical and cultural objects; and (y) keeping unleashed dogs; (z) ploughing up of the territory, haymaking (except for forest fire fighting purposes); and application of chemicals, fertilizers, nutrients and plant protection means.

Policy: Stratégie 2020 du Sous-Secteur Forêts et Faune au Cameroun. Plan D'Actions 2013-2017.
Policy_Content: Conscient de l’intérêt et de l’importance de la gestion et l’exploitation durables des ressources forestières et fauniques, le Cameroun, à travers une approche participative et inclusif, a adopté une Stratégie 2020 du Sous-Secteur Forêts et Faune. Fondé sur les principes de la mise en valeur, la protection et la  gestion durable des forêts ainsi que la diversité biologique, la stratégie vise un Cameroun écologiquement viable, dont les forêts et la faune contribuent de manière durable et soutenue au développement économique, social et culturel. C’est une stratégie sous sectorielle de portée national qui vise un objectif global de l’amélioration et de la gestion de la biodiversité du Cameroun de la contribution à la croissance et à la création d’emploi dans un contexte de développement durable. Spécifiquement, la stratégie vise le développement des productions forestières et fauniques, l’amélioration du cadre de vie en milieu rural, la gestion durable des ressources naturelles, l’amélioration du cadre institutionnel. Pour réaliser cet objectif, la Stratégie s’articule autour de quatre axes stratégiques qui sont: l’amélioration de la gestion durable des forêts, la sécurisation et la valorisation des ressources fauniques et des aires protégées, la valorisation des ressources forestières, l’amélioration de la gestion et de la gouvernance du sous-secteur.

Policy: Economic and Social Development Plan 2012 – 2013.
Policy_Content: The Economic and Social Development Plan for the year 2012 – 2013 is the first step of a development program extended until 2022. The Plan is a multi-sectoral document at national level that analyzes the development the development envisaged in the various sectors (agriculture, transformation industry, petroleum and natural gas, electricity, transportation, Suez canal, tourism, communication and information technology) and the strategies for achieving this programmatic development. It envisages an economic growth of 3.5% with a sensible unemployment reduction in various sectors. Policy: Regional Law No. 114-PK “On the modalities of concession of plots of subsoil of local significance”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal grounds for regulation of relations originating in the process of concession of plots of subsoil of local significance by the regional executive body appointed by the Regional Government. The aforesaid plots of subsoil shall include: (a) plots of subsoil containing common widespread minerals; and (b) plots of subsoil designated for construction of underground facilities of local and regional significance not related to mining. Te aforesaid plots of subsoil shall be conceded for exploration, prospecting and extraction of common widespread minerals. Subsoil user to whom was conceded plot of subsoil shall have exclusive right of subsoil management in accordance with licensed activities. Period of validity of exploration and prospecting licence shall be 5 years, mining licence – 1 year, and construction of underground facilities – for unlimited (open-ended) period.

Policy: Order No. 377 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on National Park “Kletnyanskiy”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that the scope of institution of this National Park shall be with a view of conservation of unique natural complexes and ecosystems, and to use it for educational, recreational and scientific research purposes. Boundaries of the national Park shall be subject to particular protection and shall be taken into consideration in the process of land-use planning, forest management and land and forest inventory. National Park shall carry out the following tasks: (a) ecosystem preservation; (b) conservation of the objects of cultural heritage; (c) ecological education; (d) tourism; (e) scientific research; (f) state ecological monitoring; and (g) restoration of disturbed and damaged natural, historical and cultural complexes. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) exploration and mining; (b) agro-forestry; (c) timber extraction and procurement of non-timber products; and (d) commercial hunting and fisheries.

Policy: Ministerial Decision No. 7858/MONRE on the Ozone Depleting Substances Management.
Policy_Content: This Decision, consisting of six Chapters, establises the Ozone Depleting Substances Management. It aims at defining the principle, rule and measure to control of Import, Export, Transit, Distribution and utilization of Ozone Depleting Substances (ODS) and ODS-based equipment. This Decision is enacted for managing and monitoring the utilization of ODS and ODS-based equipment and related business operation in full compliance with obligations under the Montreal Protocol on Phase-Out the Ozone Depleting Substances, aiming at prevention of depleting of the ozone layer, ensuring health safety of human, animal and plant as well as protecting environment to foster the socio-economic development of the country. The Decision is divided as follos: General Provisions (I); Ozone Depleting Substances and Areas of their Applications (II); Management, Utilization and Operation of ODS and ODS-based Equipment Business (III); Management and Monitoring (IV); Awards and Sanctions (V) and Final Provisions (VI).

Policy: Order No. 376 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on the national park “Trans-Baikal”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that the location of the national park “Trans-Baikal” shall be Buryatia region of the Russian Federation. National park “Trans-Baikal” shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and objects; (b) conservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) promotion of regulated tourism and recreation; (e) development and introduction of scientific methods of nature protection and environmental education; (f) implementation of state environmental monitoring; and (g) restoration of disturbed natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects. On the territory of the national park, shall be prohibited any activity that can damage natural complexes and objects of flora and fauna, cultural and historical objects and which contradicts the purposes and tasks of the national park, including: (a) exploration and mining; (b) disturbance of the soil cover and geological outcrops; (c) activities entailing changes in the hydrological regime; (d) allotment of land parcels for horticulture and smallholding; (e) construction of main roads, pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities, except for tourism industry facilities, museums and information centers, facilities related to the functioning of the national park and the functioning of settlement located within its boundaries; (f) logging (except for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) commercial hunting and commercial fisheries; (i) procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (with the exception of procurement by citizens of such resources for their own personal needs); (j) disturbance of natural habitats of wild fauna and wild flora species; (k) biological collections, except for research purposes, envisaged by thematic and research plans of the Institution; (l) introduction of living organisms in order to acclimatize them; (m) passage and grazing of domestic animals outside common-use roads and authorize trails; (n) water logging; (o) organization of mass sports and entertainment events, organization of tourist camps and making bonfires outside the specially designated places for such purpose; (p) unauthorized conduct of archaeological excavations, collection and removal of objects of historical and cultural value; (q) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, including hunting firearms and hunting gear; (r) blasting operations; (s) burning of vegetation (with the exception of fire-fighting measures implemented in coordination with the Institution); (t) clear cutting of forest species and shrubbery, with the exception of sanitary felling, felling associated with extinguishing forest fires, including the creation of fire breaks, and felling associated with the construction, reconstruction and operation of line facilities carried out in accordance with this Regulations; (u) waste disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste, radioactive waste, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances; application of  chemicals, mineral fertilizers and nutrients (except for land plots used by owners and tenants for agricultural purposes); (v) washing vehicles on the banks of waterbodies; (w) movement and parking of motorized vehicles outside public roads and specially designated places (except for cases related to the functioning of the national park); (x) destruction and damage of posts, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs, developed ecological paths and recreation areas, buildings on the territory of the national park, as well as property of the Institution, inscriptions and signs on boulders, outcrops and historical and cultural objects; (y) ploughing up of the territory (except for forest fire fighting purposes); and (z) walking unleashed dogs.

Policy: Law No. 964 “On anti-corruption expertise of normative legal acts and draft normative legal acts.”
Policy_Content: This Law regulates legal and organizational framework for anti-corruption examination of regulatory legal acts and draft regulatory legal acts in order to identify in corruption-generating factors and taking measures to eliminate these factors. State anti-corruption expertise of regulatory legal acts and draft regulatory legal acts shall be intended activities to identify corruption-generating factors in regulatory legal acts, draft regulatory legal acts, carried out in the manner prescribed by the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan, entities authorized to conduct state anti-corruption expertise, based on the results of which an opinion is given, subject to mandatory consideration by the relevant state bodies. Anti-corruption expertise of regulatory legal acts and draft regulatory of legal acts shall be based on the following principles: (a) validity, impartiality (disinterestedness), objectivity and verifiability of results of anti-corruption expertise of regulatory legal acts and draft regulatory legal acts; (b) competence of persons conducting anti-corruption expertise of regulatory legal acts and draft regulatory legal acts; (c) independence of experts from the law-making body; (d) obligation to conduct anti-corruption expertise of draft regulatory legal acts; (e) cooperation and exchange of information between state bodies, self-government of villages and rural districts (their officials) with citizens and public organizations in conducting anti-corruption expertise of regulatory legal acts and draft regulatory legal acts; (f)  obligation to consider the conclusion of the anti-corruption expertise of regulatory legal acts and draft regulatory legal acts; (g) transparency and ensuring the possibility of familiarization with the results of anti-corruption examination of regulatory legal acts and draft regulatory legal acts; and (h) responsibility of the subjects authorized to conduct anti-corruption expertise regulatory legal acts and draft regulatory legal acts for the quality of anti-corruption expertise.

Policy: Kenya Nuclear Electricity Board Order, 2012 (L.N. No. 131 of 2012).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under the State Corporations Act, establish the Kenya Nuclear Electricity Board as a body corporate, define it functions and powers and provide with respect to its administration and functioning. The Board, shall, among other things: (a) promote and expedite the development of nuclear electricity in Kenya; (b) develop policies, and propose legislation necessary for the successful implementation of a nuclear power programme; and (c) identify, prepare and facilitate the implementation of a roadmap for a nuclear power programme. Policy: DENR Memorandum Order No. 2012-02 establishing the Uniform Replacement Ratio for Cut or Relocated Trees.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the Uniform Replacement Ratio for Cut or Relocated Trees. For uniformity of application of regulations pertaining to the replacement ratio for cut or relocated trees, the following specifications are hereby issued: Tree cutting permits covered by exemptions under "similar activities" of Section No. 2, Item 2.2 of Executive Order No. 23 shall be governed by the Memorandum from the Executive Secretary dated 20 October 2011, or a replacement ratio of 1:100. All tree cutting permits excluded in the said Memorandum shall be governed by the following: 2.1 NO replacements shall be applied to planted trees within private lands and forest lands and exclusively established for tree plantations/timber production purposes; For planted trees in private and forest lands not covered under item 2.1 tree replacement shall be 1:50 while naturally growing trees on the same areas, including those affected by development projects shall have 1:100 ratio in support of the National Greening Programme (NGP) and climate change initiatives of the Government. In order to facilitate the implementation of tree replacement, seedling donation and identification of common planting sites shall be encouraged for more impact, especially in urban areas. Planted trees removed shall be replaced preferably with indigenous tree species while naturally growing trees shall be strictly replaced with indigenous tree species.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Regional Law No. 70 “On energy saving and raising energy efficiency”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of energy saving and raising energy efficiency. The scope of this Regional Law shall be to set forth legal, economic and organizational basis for stimulation of energy saving and raising energy efficiency. Main provisions in the sphere of energy saving shall be as follows: (a) liquidation of uncontrolled use of energy resources in the process of energy generation, transformation, transportation, distribution and consumption; (b) stimulation of investments in energy saving; (c) promotion of renewable energy; (d) incentives to consumers for passage to consumption of energy in evening and night hours; (e) monitoring and assessment of consumption of energy resources; and (f) enforcement of legislation in the sphere of energy saving and energy efficiency.

Policy: European Communities (Forest Consent and Assessment) (Amendment) Regulations 2012 (S.I. No. 442 of 2012).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the European Communities (Forest Consent and Assessment) Regulations 2010 for the purpose of giving effect to Council Directive No. 2011/92/EU insofar as it applies to development consent in respect of forestry. They require the Minister to carry out, in accordance with these Regulations and the Council Directive an environment impact assessment in respect of: (a) a class (or classes) of development prescribed by Regulations under section 176 of the Planning and Development Act 2000 that equals or exceeds a quantity, area or other limit prescribed by those Regulations; or (b) or development that does not exceed a quantity, area or other limit prescribed under Regulations, but which the Minister determines would be likely to have significant effects on the environment. The Minister shall consider the content of the Environmental Impact Statement (EIS) submitted as part of the application. If the EIS (or other material) is, in the opinion of the Minister, inadequate, the Minister shall serve a notice requiring the applicant to submit further information to remedy these inadequacies.

Policy: Order No. 1027 on public afforestation subsidy.
Policy_Content: The Order sets regulations on the subsidy for public reforestation of Danish forestry areas. These subsidies apply to forests on publicly or privately owned agricultural land, including areas allocated for the improvement/preparatory treatments of soil, purchase of plants, planting and fence building. The requiring criteria for receiving subsidy grants shall be in adherence to article 4 of the Forest Act. Areas must measure min. 5 hectares where plantation of suitable tree species shall take place no later than 31 May 2014. Said areas shall be required to have been of commercial farming prior to subsidy application, or that have not received financial support for agri-environmental activities in adherence to the Ministry of Food regulations. Application for subsidy shall be submitted to the Danish Nature Agency no later than 1 December 2013; payment shall be of two installments (75% and 25% of total amount).

Policy: Decreto Nº 352/012 - Defínese la situación de emergencia granjera y créase la Comisión de Emergencia Granjera (CEG).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto establece la Comisión de Emergencia Granjera, la cual funcionará en la órbita de la Dirección General de la Granja del Ministerio de Ganadería, Agricultura y Pesca. Su cometido principal consiste en proponer al Ministro de Ganadería Agricultura y Pesca la declaración de emergencia granjera, delimitando el período, el o los rubros, el área afectada a nivel de departamento o sección judicial o policial y definir las pautas técnicas. Policy: Decreto Nº 39 - Aprueba Reglamento para la dictación de planes de prevención y descontaminación.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto regula el procedimiento para la elaboración de los Planes de Prevención y de Descontaminación, así como el procedimiento y los criterios para la revisión y actualización de dichos planes. El Plan de Prevención es un instrumento de gestión ambiental que, a través de la definición e implementación de medidas y acciones específicas, tiene por finalidad evitar la superación de una o más normas de calidad ambiental primaria o secundaria, en una zona latente. El Plan de Descontaminación es un instrumento de gestión ambiental que, a través de la definición e implementación de medidas y acciones específicas, tiene por finalidad recuperar los niveles señalados en las normas primarias o secundarias de calidad ambiental de una zona calificada como saturada por uno o más contaminantes.

Policy: Decreto Nº 40 - Reglamento del Sistema de Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental.
Policy_Content: El presente Reglamento establece las disposiciones que rigen el Sistema de Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental y la participación de la comunidad en el proceso de Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental, de conformidad con los preceptos de la Ley Nº 19.300, sobre Bases Generales del Medio Ambiente. El artículo 3º enumera los proyectos o actividades que deberán someterse al Sistema de Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental, por ser susceptibles de causar impacto ambiental, en cualesquiera de sus fases. Entre ellos se contemplan los siguientes : a) acueductos, embalses o tranques y sifones que deban someterse a la autorización establecida en el artículo 294 del Código de Aguas; b) líneas de transmisión eléctrica de alto voltaje y sus subestaciones; c) centrales generadoras de energía mayores a 3 MW; d) reactores y establecimientos nucleares e instalaciones relacionadas ; e) puertos, vías de navegación, astilleros y terminales marítimos; f) proyectos de desarrollo minero, incluidos los de carbón, petróleo y gas, comprendiendo las prospecciones, explotaciones, plantas procesadoras y disposición de residuos y estériles, así como la extracción industrial de áridos, turba o greda ; g) agroindustrias, mataderos, planteles y establos de crianza, lechería y engorda de animales, de dimensiones industriales.  Cabe señalar el artículo 85, referido a la consulta a pueblos indígenas. Cuando los proyectos afecten directamente a uno o más grupos humanos pertenecientes a pueblos indígenas, el Servicio de Evaluación Ambiental deberá diseñar y desarrollar un proceso de consulta de buena fe, que contemple mecanismos apropiados según las características socioculturales propias de cada pueblo y a través de sus instituciones representativas, de modo que puedan participar de manera informada y tengan la posibilidad de influir durante el proceso de evaluación ambiental.

Policy: Regulation No. 1020 on emergency storage of seed grains.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Regulation is to ensure adequate supplies of seed in the spring season, by granting subsidy for the storage of seed grain. Seed grain eligible for subsidy shall be inspected and certified by the national Agricultural Authorities. Application for such grants shall be submitted no later than 1 October. Certified seed grains exceeding 5% of trader’s average turnover of corn for the last three crop seasons are eligible for subsidy. Grants shall not be disbursed for stock in excess of 25%. The grant is calculated on the basis of provisions on rates specified in or pursuant to the Agricultural Agreement.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 491-p validating the Regulation on protected natural territory of regional significance – state nature reserve “Ust-Tarsky”.
Policy_Content: State nature reserve of regional significance “Ust-Tarsky” shall be considered biological (zoological) reserve constituted with a view of conservation and reproduction of precious, rare and endangered wild fauna species and natural habitats thereof. Protected natural area of regional significance shall be organized for an unlimited period of time for the following purposes: (a) conservation of natural complexes and objects of the forest-steppe zone of the Western Siberia in a natural state; (b) conservation, reproduction and restoration of natural resources, enrichment of adjoining land areas used for economic activities; (c) protection of reproductive habitats of elk, roe deer, hares, grouse birds, gray goose, badger settlements, other species of wild animals; (d) protection of habitats of rare and endangered species of animals, plants and mushrooms; (e) maintenance of ecological balance and stability of functioning of ecosystems; (f) protection of winter camps and elk migration routes; and (g) ensuring environmental education of the population. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) all forms and types of hunting; (b) all types of fisheries; (c) all types of felling except for sanitary felling and selective felling; (d) destruction of forest outliers by any economic activity; (e) harvesting and procurement of non-timber forest products, except for procurement and collection of twigs for fodder; (f) procurement of edible non-timber products and medicinal plants except for procurement thereof by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) creation of forest plantations and operation thereof, cultivation of forest fruit bearing, ornamental and medicinal plant species; (i) use of forests for wood processing; (j) application and storage of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers and nutrients; (k) haymaking, grazing and passage of cattle outside specially allotted areas; (l) destruction or removal from natural environment of endangered plant species and mushrooms; (m) ploughing up of the territory; (n) destruction of nidifugous burrows, except for harmful animals; (o) devastation of nests and collection of eggs (except for crows); (p) drainage and irrigation, exploration of subsoil and mining; (q) burning of vegetation; (r) blasting operations; (s) water logging, construction of water reservoirs and other artificial waterbodies, and construction of waterworks; (t) allotment of land plots for construction, collective gardening and horticulture; (u) release and acclimatization of alien species; (u) zoological, botanical, mineralogical and paleontological collections; (v) recreational activities; (w) destruction or damaging of barriers, boards and other information displays and indication signs; (x) washing vehicles in water protection areas and movement of motor vehicles outside roads of common access; (y) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons; and (z) stay with unleashed dogs outside residential areas, sharpening and training of hunting dogs.

Policy: Directive 2012/27/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on energy efficiency, amending Directives 2009/125/EC and 2010/30/EU and repealing Directives 2004/8/EC and 2006/32/EC.
Policy_Content: This Directive establishes a common framework of measures for the promotion of energy efficiency within the European Union. The aim is to achieve within 2020 the European Union’s 20 percent headline target on energy efficiency. Further it lays down rules designed to remove barriers in the energy market and overcome market failures that impede efficiency in the supply and use of energy, and provides for the establishment of indicative national energy efficiency targets for 2020. Policy: Order No. 380 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on National Park “Kyrshskaya kosa”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that the scope of institution of this National Park shall be with a view of conservation of unique natural complexes and ecosystems, and to use it for educational, recreational and scientific research purposes. Boundaries of the national Park shall be subject to particular protection and shall be taken into consideration in the process of land-use planning, forest management and land and forest inventory. National Park shall carry out the following tasks: (a) ecosystem preservation; (b) conservation of the objects of cultural heritage; (c) ecological education; (d) tourism; (e) scientific research; (f) state ecological monitoring; and (g) restoration of disturbed and damaged natural, historical and cultural complexes. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) exploration and mining; (b) agro-forestry; (c) timber extraction and procurement of non-timber products; and (d) commercial hunting and fisheries.
